question: Choose facts about continue; statement is C Language.
option1: A) continue; is used to take the execution control to next iteration or sequence
option2: B) continue; statement causes the statements below it to skip for execution
option3: C) continue; is usually accompanied by IF statement.

question: Choose a correct statement about C break; statement.?
option1: A) break; statement can be used inside switch block
option2: B) break; statement can be used with loops like for, while and do while.
option3: C) break; statement causes only the same or inner loop where break; is present to quit suddenly.

question: Choose a correct statement about C language break; statement.
option1: A) A single break; statement can force execution control to come out of only one loop.
option2: B) A single break; statement can force execution control to come out of a maximum of two nested loops.
option3: C) A single break; statement can force execution control to come out of a maximum of three nested loops.

question:
Choose a correct C Statement regarding for loop.
for(; ;);
option1: A) for loop works exactly first time
option2: B) for loop works infinite number of times

question: What are C ASCII character ranges.?
Expand or Abbreviate ASCII with regard to C Language.
option1: A) Australian Standard Code for Information Interchange
option2: B) American Standard Code for Information Interchange
option3: C) American Symbolic Code for Information Interchange
option4: D) Australian Symbolic Code for Information Interchange
